title: That the General Committee meeting minutes of February 27, March 6 and 13, 2023 be approved.
That Report CLSFS23-026 – Active Transportation Fund be approved on Consent.

parking area is designed to permit forward-facing access to an arterial street; and b) That the subject property be rezoned from D.2 – Development District to R.2, 4k,10a – 355 – Residential District, in accordance with the draft amendment attached as Exhibit ‘C’ to Report IPSPL23-010.

That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report IPSPL23-011, dated April 3, 2023, of the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: a) That Section 3.9, Exceptions of Zoning By-law 1997-123 be amended to add Exception .356 which identifies site-specific regulations to recognize existing deficiencies in the width of the parking access aisle and the area of landscaped open space; and b) That the subject property be rezoned from C.5 – Commercial District to SP.241 –356 – Commercial District, in accordance with the draft amendment attached as Exhibit ‘C’ to Report IPSPL23-011.

c) That the subject property be rezoned from C.6 – Commercial District to C.6- 357-H – Commercial District in accordance with the Draft Amendment attached as Exhibit E of Report IPSPL23-012; and d) That the ‘H’ Holding Symbol be removed at such time as: 1. Site Plan Approval has been granted for the property, which will include the following requirements: i. The Owner shall make any necessary improvements to the laneway, to the City's satisfaction, in support of the proposed development; and ii. The Owner will be responsible for all financial costs associated with the improvements.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSCLK23-008, dated April 3, 2023 of the City Clerk as follows: a) That the presentation from the Peterborough Community Health Centre be received for information; and, b) That a letter of support be provided by the City of the Peterborough to the Ontario Health Team in support of the Peterborough Ontario Health Team‘s application to the province for annual funding in the amount of $8.2 million for a Community Health Centre, that will serve both the City and County of Peterborough.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSCLK23-008, dated April 3, 2023 of the City Clerk as follows: a) That the presentation from the Peterborough Community Health Centre be received for information; and, b) That a letter of support be provided by the City of the Peterborough to the Ontario Health Team in support of the Peterborough Ontario Health Team‘s application to the province for annual funding in the amount of $8.2 million for a Community Health Centre, that will serve both the City and County of Peterborough. That Council, through their authority as set out in Chart 3 of Appendix A of the City’s Procurement By-law 22-070, approve the recommendation outlined in Report IPSACP23-006, dated April 3, 2023 from the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: That the contract for ITT-19-22 with Buildscapes Construction Ltd., 457 Garyray Drive, Toronto Ontario, M9L 1P6, for Construction Services for the Cedargrove Park Stormwater Management Facility Sediment Removal and Retrofit project be increased by $357,912.15 from $2,511,913.97 to $2,869,826.12, plus HST of $373,077.40 for a total cost of $3,242,903.52.
That City Staff prepare a Report outlining the estimated cost to have administered the election of Local School Boards Trustees, as part of the 2022 Municipal Election.
That the matter previously approved at the March 27th Council meeting involving a letter of support for Ontario Arts Council funding be rescinded.
That this meeting adjourn at 9:47 p.m.
